name: authoritatively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows you are confident, in control, and expect to be respected and obeyed: He speaks his mind quickly and authoritatively. It's amazing what you can achieve when you clearly and authoritatively insist.
in a way that is complete and accurate or done by an expert, and therefore can be respected: In this book the author authoritatively sets out the evidence on the problems facing the economy. The recommended standards have been authoritatively formulated and reviewed by a panel of experts. See
authoritative
More examplesFewer examplesHe authoritatively reassured the public that the risks of nuclear power were negligible.She is an author and editor who can speak authoritatively about children’s literature.Authoritatively assembled material was submitted to the school transition team.We publish works that are seriously researched and authoritatively written.
